messages.content: What is the purpose of the img2colors-comfyui-node?
The img2colors-comfyui-node is a custom node in ComfyUI that uses KMeans clustering to extract the dominant colors from an image.
What libraries does the img2colors-comfyui-node use to get the closest matching color names?
The img2colors-comfyui-node uses the `webcolors` and `colornamer` libraries to get the closest matching color names from various color naming systems.
What does the `get_complementary` toggler in the img2colors-comfyui-node do?
The `get_complementary` toggler in the img2colors-comfyui-node allows the user to get the complementary colors instead of the extracted dominant colors.
What are the requirements for the img2colors-comfyui-node?
The requirements for the img2colors-comfyui-node are: colornamer==0.2.3, scikit_learn>=1.4.0, and webcolors==1.13.
How can you install the img2colors-comfyui-node?

To install the img2colors-comfyui-node, you need to `cd` to the `ComfyUI/custom_nodes` directory, `git clone` the repository, `cd` to the `img2colors-comfyui-node` directory, and run `pip install -r requirements.txt`.
What are the color name categories from webcolors used in the img2colors-comfyui-node?
The color name categories from webcolors used in the img2colors-comfyui-node are CSS3, CSS2, CSS2.1, and HTML4 webcolors.
What are the color name categories from colornamer used in the img2colors-comfyui-node?
The color name categories from colornamer used in the img2colors-comfyui-node are XKCD, Design, Common, Color Families, Color or Neutral, and Color Type.
